SEARCH
Package fang2.sprites

Class PolyLineSprite

java.lang.Object
fang2.core.Sprite
fang2.sprites.PolyLineSprite
Direct Known Subclasses:
LineSprite
public class PolyLineSprite extends Sprite
A sprite composed of line and curve segments. This sprite does not include fill; for filled sprites with arbitrary outlines, see PolygonSprite.

  • Field Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • PolyLineSprite

      public PolyLineSprite()
      creates a polyline from (0, 0) to (1, 1)

    • PolyLineSprite

      public PolyLineSprite(double... points)
      creates a polyline given a set of 2 or more coordinates. Note: every pair of values represents the next (x, y) coordinate, therefore the number of parameters must be even. The PolyLineSprite does not automatically close shapes. If you want a closed shape, use PolygonSprite instead.
      Parameters:
      points - the set of (x,y) pairs for the desired line

    • PolyLineSprite

      public PolyLineSprite(int sides)
      Construct a new, outlined, regular PolyLineSprite with the given number of sides. Uses PolyLineSprite.makePolygonPoints method to generate the corner points. That routine has the built-in check to make sure side count >= 3.
      Parameters:
      sides - number of sides of the regular polygon; sides >= 3

    • PolyLineSprite

      public PolyLineSprite(Location2D... points)
      creates a polyline given a set of 2 or more coordinates. The PolyLineSprite does not automatically close shapes. If you want a closed shape, use PolygonSprite instead.
      Parameters:
      points - the set of (x,y) pairs for the desired line

    • PolyLineSprite

      public PolyLineSprite(Point2D.Double... points)
      creates a polyline given a set of 2 or more coordinates. The PolyLineSprite does not automatically close shapes. If you want a closed shape, use PolygonSprite instead.
      Parameters:
      points - the set of (x,y) pairs for the desired line

    • PolyLineSprite

      public PolyLineSprite(Shape shape)
      creates a polyline from the outline of any given shape.
      Parameters:
      shape - the closed shape from which an outline should be drawn.

    • PolyLineSprite

      public PolyLineSprite(Sprite sprite)
      creates a polyline from the outline of any given sprite.
      Parameters:
      sprite - the sprite from which an outline should be drawn.

  • Method Details

    • getInitialLineThickness

      public static double getInitialLineThickness()
      Get the default line thickness, the line thickness used by all newly created PolyLineSprites from this point forward.
      Returns:
      the default (constructed, initial) line thickness in screen widths

    • makePolygonPoints

      public static Location2D[] makePolygonPoints(int sides)
      Generate point-set for a polygon with the given number of sides; if sides is invalid input: '<'= 3, generate a triangle.
      Parameters:
      sides - the number of sides in the polygon (sides >= 3)

    • setInitialLineThickness

      public static void setInitialLineThickness(double lineThickness)
      Set the line thickness used for all newly created PolyLineSprite objects. When a sprite is created, it copies this thickness (in screens) as its line thickness and no longer uses this value.
      Parameters:
      lineThickness - the new inital line thickness in screens

    • getLineDashLength

      public double getLineDashLength()
      gets the portion of the screen each dash takes up. The return value of this method changes as the size of the sprite changes.
      Returns:
      the portion of the screen each dash takes up

    • getLineDashPattern

      public float[] getLineDashPattern()
      gets the on/off pattern of the dashes used in drawing the outline. The pattern is an ordered list of on and off alternating. For example 0.2f, 0.1f, 0.4f, 0.3f means 0.2f of outline, skip 0.1f, 0.4f of outline skip 0.3f then repeat. The pattern sizes change when the size of the sprite changes.
      Returns:
      the on/off pattern of the dashes used in drawing the outline

    • getLineThickness

      public double getLineThickness()
      gets the portion of the screen used in drawing the polyline. Note: the line thickness changes as the size of the sprite changes.
      Returns:
      thickness of the line in screens

    • hasBevelJoin

      public boolean hasBevelJoin()
      determines if line segments are joined with a straight line at the edge
      Returns:
      true if the segments are joined with a straignt edge, false otherwise

    • hasButtCap

      public boolean hasButtCap()
      determines if the end of the line has extra added or not
      Returns:
      true if there is no extra space at the end of the line, false otherwise

    • hasMiterJoin

      public boolean hasMiterJoin()
      determines if line segments are extended until they join
      Returns:
      true if the segments do extend, false otherwise

    • hasRoundCap

      public boolean hasRoundCap()
      determines if the end of the line is capped with a small circle
      Returns:
      true if the end of the line has a circle, false otherwise

    • hasRoundJoin

      public boolean hasRoundJoin()
      determines if line segments are joined with a round edge
      Returns:
      true if the segments are joined with a round edge, false otherwise

    • hasSquareCap

      public boolean hasSquareCap()
      determines if the end of the line is capped with a small square
      Returns:
      true if the end of the line has a square, false otherwise

    • initPath

      protected void initPath(Point2D.Double... points)
      converts the points into a GeneralPath, then initializes the outline shape
      Parameters:
      points - a set of connected points

    • initShape

      protected void initShape(boolean firstTime)
      uses the lines and stroke to create and set the shape
      Parameters:
      firstTime - true meaning this should set the size and location, false meaning that this should only set the shape

    • setLineDashLength

      public void setLineDashLength(double length)
      sets the length of the dashes used in drawing the polyline. This length changes when the size of the sprite changes.
      Parameters:
      length - the length of each dash as a portion of the screen

    • setLineDashPattern

      public void setLineDashPattern(float... dashes)
      sets the on/off pattern of the dashes used in drawing the polyline. The pattern is an ordered list of on and off alternating. For example 0.2f, 0.1f, 0.4f, 0.3f means 0.2f of outline, skip 0.1f, 0.4f of outline skip 0.3f then repeat. The pattern sizes change when the size of the sprite changes.
      Parameters:
      dashes - the on/off pattern of the dashes used in drawing the outline

    • setLineThickness

      public void setLineThickness(double thickness)
      sets the portion of the screen that the polyline thickness should fill.
      Parameters:
      thickness - the width of the polyline as a portion of the screen

    • useBevelJoin

      public void useBevelJoin()
      makes line segments join by drawing a line between the endpoints.

    • useButtCap

      public void useButtCap()
      makes it so that the line does not extend past the end point. The cap is the end of the line and butt means that there is no extra space after the end point (unlike with square and round caps).

    • useMiterJoin

      public void useMiterJoin()
      makes line segments join by extending the segment edges until they meet.

    • useRoundCap

      public void useRoundCap()
      makes it so that the line extends past the end point by adding a small circle. The cap is the end of the line and round means that a circle the diameter of the line should be added as extra space at the end of the line.

    • useRoundJoin

      public void useRoundJoin()
      makes line segments join with rounded edges.

    • useSquareCap

      public void useSquareCap()
      makes it so that the line extends past the end point by adding a small square. The cap is the end of the line and square means that a square the width of the line should be added as extra space at the end of the line.
